definition: to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
to throw/to fling/to swing/to leave behind/to throw off/to dump (sb)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.chinese: 母牛飕地甩动它的尾巴。

sentences.english: The horse whisked its tail angrily.
sentences.chinese: 那匹马发著怒甩动的尾巴。

sentences.english: It is illegal to shake carpets in the street, or to throw orange peels on the sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 在街上甩动地毯或将橘子皮丢在人行道上是违法的。

sentences.english: He whips that "log" of a racquet around like a swizzle-stick.
sentences.chinese: 他甩动这笨得象木头的拍子如同耍调酒的小棍。

sentences.english: The cat's tail lashed about angrily.
sentences.chinese: 那猫的尾巴愤怒地甩动着。
母牛飕地甩动它的尾巴。

sentences.english: The horse swithed its tail to drive the flies away.
sentences.chinese: 马甩动尾巴以驱赶苍蝇。

sentences.english: The killer flung the calf around until it fainted. Water splashed all around.
sentences.chinese: 虎鲸猛烈甩动着嘴里的小海豹，溅起漫天水花。

sentences.english: The horse was flicking flies away with its tail.
sentences.chinese: 马轻轻地甩动尾巴把苍蝇赶走。
那只猫叼着那只耗子甩动。

sentences.english: Great hypnotists do not need to swing a pocket watch from a chain.
sentences.chinese: 伟大的催眠术士并不需要甩动怀表的链子。

definition: to sway/to swing/to move back and forth/to oscillate
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to fan/to flap/to incite/to instigate (a strike etc)
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
to raise one's head/to perk up
